column4: glxgears is still really choppy, compiz is sluggish, syngery is horrid and is eating all my cpu cycles, nvidia-settings doesn't start properly and this all happens in both the 386 and 686 kernels :[
I dont know much about sis hw, are you using the right driver for ir?
No sis, it's a centrino laptop (banias) with an nvidia FX5200 Go
As far as I know.  I just followed the nvidia guide everyone here points people to.
using the nv or nvidia driver and are the kernel drivers for nvidia stuff?
I'm not sure about the kernel thing.. that's what I'm thinking might be messed up, but I don't know how to tell.
did you install linux-restricted-drivers for your kernel?
hrmm damn I dunno then, I havent ever messed with the go cards, try ubuntuforums
Everything was working fine before I got the 686 kernel too
Yes, but it's sluggish now too.
And the nvidia-settings program doesn't work in it either
I'm at a loss, mostly because I need some more rest, but check out the ubuntu forums
